gurmukhi: XoN kih kY Dnu ko gih kY lih kY cih kY bhu kIr kty ] iek Dwie prY pun swmuih hÍY iek Bwj gey iek sUr lty ]
transliteration: Yon Kah(i) Dhan(u) Ko Gadh Kai Lah(i) Kai Chah(i) Kai Bahu Keer Kate||
translation: Saying this and getting hold of his bow, he, in a delightful mood, chopped many warriors; some warriors came in front of him to fight and some ran away; some of the warriors fell down on the earth;

gurmukhi: blbMf Gny iCq pY ptky Bt AYsI dSw bhu hyr hty ] kib sXwm mnY iqh Awhv mY su rhy kyaU bIr Pty eI Pty ]1614]
transliteration: Balband Ghane Chhit Pai Patke Bhat Aisidashaa Bahu Her Hate|| Kabi Syaam Manai Tih Aahav Mai Su Rahe Keoo Beer Phate Ee Phate||1614||
translation: He knocked down many warriors on the ground and seeing such a spectacle of war, many warriors retraced their steps; the poet says that the warriors who were there in the battlefield, they had received some injury at least.1614.

gurmukhi: Dnu pwrQ ko iqh kwit dXo puin kwit kY BIm gdw aU igrweI ] BUpiq kI krvwr ktI khUM jwie prI kCu jwnI n jweI ]
transliteration: Dhan(u) Paarath Ko Tih Kaattee Dayo Poun(i) Kaattee Kai Bheem Gadaa Oo Giraaee|| Bhoopat(i) Kikarvaar Katikahoon Jaae Parikachhu Jaanina Jaaee||
translation: He caused the bow of Arjuna to fall down and also the mace of Bhima; the sword of the king itself was cut and it could not be known where it fell;

gurmukhi: BRwq doaU Aru sYn GnI Aiq rosBrI niRp aUpr DweI ] BUpiq bwn hnY iqh kau qn Por deI auh Er idKweI ]1615]
transliteration: Bhraat Dooo Ar(u) Sain Ghaniat(i) Ros-bharinrip Oopar Dhaaee|| Bhoopat(i) Baan Hanai Tih Kau Tan Phor Daiuh Or Dikhaaee||1615||
translation: The innumerable of Arjuna and Bhima fell upon the king, who with his loud sounding discharge of arrows, pierced the bodies of all of them.1615.

gurmukhi: sYn ACUhn qurq hI dInI iqnh sMGwr ] puin iris isau Dwvq BXo Apny SsqR sMBwr ]1616]
transliteration: Sain Achhodhhan Turat Hideenitinah Sanhaar|| Poun(i) Ris(i) Sio Dhaavat Bhayo Apne Shastra Sanbhaar||1616||
translation: The king immediately killed one large division of military unit and then in his fury, holding his weapons, he fell upon the enemy.1616.

gurmukhi: eyk ctwk cpyt hnY iek lY kr mY krvwr sMGwrY ] eykn ky aur Pwr ktwrn kysn qy gih eyk pCwrY ]
transliteration: Ek Chataak Chapet Hnai Ik Lai Kar Mai Karvaar Sanhdarai|| Ekan Ke Ur Phaar Kataaran Kesan Te Gadh Ek Pachhdarai||
translation: He killed some warriors with other weapons and some, taking his sword in his hand; he tore asunder the hearts of some with his sword and knocked down many catching them from their hair;

gurmukhi: eyk clwie dey dshUM ids eyk fry mrgy ibnu mwrY ] pYdlu ko dlu mwr dXo duh hwQn hwiQn dwNq auKwrY ]1617]
transliteration: Ek Chadhaae Dae Das-hoon Dis Ek Dare Marge Bin(u) Mdarai|| Paidal(u) Ko Dal Oo Maar Dayo Duh Haathan Haathin Daant Oukhdarai||1617||
translation: He threw and scattered some in all the ten directions and some died merely with fear; he killed the gatherings of soldiers on feet and with both hands he uprooted the tusks of the elephants.1617.

gurmukhi: pwQr Awn kmwn ghI iqh BUpiq ko iek bwn lgwXo ] lwgq hI Avswn gumwn gXo KVgyS mhw duKu pwXo ]
transliteration: Paathar Aan Kamaan Gaditih Bhoopat(i) Ik Baan Lagadyo Laagad Hiavsaan Goumaan Gado Khadgesh Mahaa Doukh(u) Paayo||
translation: Holding his bow, Arjuna discharged one arrow to the king, whose blow destroyed the pride of the king and he suffered extreme anguish;

gurmukhi: paurK pyK kY jI hiriKE bl tyr nryS su AYsu sunwXo ] DMn ipqw DMn vY jnnI ju DnMjY nwmu ijno suq jwXo ]1618]
transliteration: Paurakh Pekh Kai Jihar(i)khio Bal Ter Daresh Su Ais(u) Sounaayo|| Dhann Pitaa Dhann Vai Jananiju Dhananjai Naam Jino Sout Jaano Sout Jaayo||1618||
translation: Seeing the bravery of Arjuna, the heart of the king was pleased and he said within his hearing, ‘Bravo to the patents of Arjuna, who gave him birth.’1618.
Speech of Kharag Singh addressed to Arjuna:
